data.text:
Again, before people here start pointing to New Jersey and New York, bear in mind that Kentucky currently has (1) no mask mandate, (2) lower vaccination rates, and (3) higher infection rates. 

Which stands to reason.  Because too many folks here can’t stand to be inconvenienced.
What in Kentucky requires proof of covid vaccination to enter? Serious question.
There anyone from Kentucky going to @BABSCon #BABScon? How are you meeting the proof of vaccine requirement?

I read more about that absurd mask study released friday and among the other flaws, the cdc had conducted at least one other study designed the same way, & didn’t get the desired results. Reminds me of the Kentucky study purporting to show vaccine immunity is better, which was 1/

Very happy to hear that all my Kentucky family is on the mend from Covid. No interaction between my sister’s household and my dad’s, but living 60 miles apart, they all managed to get it at the same time. Was worried about my parents in particular. Thank God for the vaccine.

Kentuckians support Rep.Massie

Kentucky Rep. Thomas Massie vowed to never meet with executives and leaders of companies that enforce vaccine mandates on its employees or discriminate against customers based on vaccine status.

Kentucky Rep. Thomas Massie: "NOTICE: I will not take a meeting with any executive or manager of any company that is subjecting its employees to a COVID vaccine mandate or discriminating against employees or customers based on COVID vaccination status," Massie tweeted Friday.
